intro: Capnoides burmanni, commonly known as the Burmann's capnoid, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
